title: Mount Vesalius
text:
Mount Vesalius () is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> (765 m) standing northwest of <a href="Macleod%20Point">Macleod Point</a>, <a href="Liege%20Island">Liege Island</a>, in the <a href="Palmer%20Archipelago">Palmer Archipelago</a>. It surmounts <a href="Pleystor%20Glacier">Pleystor Glacier</a> to the northwest.
The peak was shown on an Argentine government chart of 1950, but was named by the <a href="United%20Kingdom%20Antarctic%20Place-Names%20Committee">United Kingdom Antarctic Place-Names Committee</a> (UK-APC) in 1960 for Vesalius (1514–1564), a Flemish anatomist who wrote a pioneer work on the structure of the human body which revolutionized the whole concept of the subject.
